text: Why not do something interesting? Set it in the 80s and use technology to make Eddie look young. "Nope, let's just aim for mediocrity." Make something just passable.
A great nostalgia grab.  This movie had the same vibe done well, unlike some other poorly done nostalgia grabs.

The first BHC is one of my favorite movies.
BHC 2 was almost as good as. BHC 3 sucked.
It just doesn’t work anymore.
Lacked in story - worst movie of the series
Nostalgia but this story was flawed from the beginning.

Despite the fear of being another bomb, capitalizing on the name of a nostalgic franchise, they managed to bring together practically all the necessary elements for good fun. It's also really cool that they brought back the main characters (although the clear lack of significant amounts of melanin can be cruel to some beings).

I watched it dubbed, for old times' sake, but even with the main voices, I found it somewhat out of the natural tone of yesteryear.

Taylour Paige is a terrible actor. She showed zero emotion, or talent. It’s like they plucked her from a Tyler Perry stable of bad actors. The father-daughter dynamic you would expect from Axl Foley’s progeny was not there. Billy and Taggert didn't age well at all. Kevin Bacon looks like Gavin Newsome.
Beverly Hills Cop: Axel F delivers some classic Eddie Murphy charm, yet the Netflix treatment renders much of the proceedings anemic.
It's not bad but for sure not my favourite of the Beverly hills cops movies. I felt it lacked that great humour it had in the previous ones.
What a s**t film, I'm not sure where to start and I cannot be bothered 😂

Beverly Hills cop 4 reignites that spark of original film, it hinges on nostalgia but underneath all the comedy and flair is a story about a father who’s seeking redemption from his daughter. This is the heart of the film and it’s carefully interwoven into the general plot. The film begins with Axel chasing down bad guys in the downtown streets of Detroit much to the dismay of his colleagues. Once business is settled he leaves for Los Angeles where he reunites with Billy & Taggart to stop a mysterious enemy from killing Jane when her involvement in a criminal case turns ugly. 
The trio are back kicking ass, it’s great to see their chemistry reignited. The screenwriting is fresh blending the humour, drama and action nicely. Throw in newcomers Joseph Gordon Levitt as a former love interest and Kevin Bacon as a slick, charming antagonist and you’ve got yourself a winner.  Beverley Hills Cop 4 is a simplified effort, it doesn’t add anything new to the series but Eddie Murphy’s return as Axel Foley is comedy gold. He hasn’t missed a step, slipping on those shades like it’s 1984 all over again.
Even some vintage Eddie Murphy can't save the film that relies on nostalgia that really wasn't there
Charismatic and nostalgic, Beverly Hills Cop: Axel F rescues with good humor a story that was perhaps worn out, great entertainment.
This was actually good. Like I felt I was watching a good sequel to Beverly Hills Cop. Some of the parts were cheesy as they try to tie back to the only films, but for the most part this was awesome.
Hope will see more of these soon
Great to see Foley, Taggart and Rosewood back in action together after all these years.. still fun and exciting
Was great action and fun to see old faces. Much better than the 3rd film .

Beverly Hills Cop: Axel F is determined to return to the 1980s era of action films. Since I grew up watching most of these movies in their reruns during the 1990s, I found myself feeling nostalgic for this kind of “simple minded” cinema. Make no mistake, the jokes are high-brow—so much so that some take a minute to sink in, you might find yourself laughing after the fact. And what about Eddie Murphy? Like Jim Carey or Adam Sandler, he’s almost his own genre of performance that it’s hard to compare his seasoned comedic chops to anyone other than Eddie Murphy himself. Which is to say, how does this compare to other Beverly Hills Cop films? Well, it doesn’t quite reach the thrills of the first, but doesn’t seem as stalled out as the third entry. It exists somewhere in-between, and for this reviewer that’s good enough to recommend for the throwback thrills.

A very fun Movie to watch, I mean it isn't really different to the first or 2nd one but it definitely has some better and more improved action and stunts, I kind of expected a little better of the reunion of the original cast but it was still nice seeing them on set together, overall this was a very fun movie to watch and probably is one of the best one out of all 4 movies.
